channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: BP shares drop 3% after warning of up to $2 billion impairment, weak refining margins
item.description: BP on Tuesday said it expects to post an impairment of up to $2 billion in the second quarter, also warning of lower refining margins.

item.title: Iran has voted in a reformist president — but change remains distant
item.description: Despite Pezeshkian's stated support for relaxing things like headscarf penalties, Iran-focused human rights groups are not optimistic.

item.title: Singapore state investor Temasek to focus on early adopters of AI in the U.S.; cautious on China
item.description: The state investor said that the U.S. will still be the largest destination for its capital, although it is also looking to increase its focus on India and Japan.

item.title: Barcelona protesters throw items and spray travelers with water while shouting ‘tourists go home’
item.description: The protesters — angry about the city's long-standing problems with overtourism — also used tape to block hotel entrances and sidewalk cafes in Barceloneta.

item.title: Stolen crypto doubled to $1.38 billion in the first half of 2024, research firm says
item.description: $1.38 billion of crypto was stolen by hackers from January 1 to June 24, as compared to $657 million stolen in the same period a year ago, TRM Labs data showed.

item.title: Inflation outrage: Even as prices stabilize, Walmart, Chipotle and others feel the heat from skeptical customers
item.description: Customers' deep frustration with higher prices has pushed many retailers and restaurants to step up discounts, promotions and value meals.

item.title: The sting of an Airbnb rejection: Hosts explain why they turn down all sorts of travelers
item.description: Social media, credit cards that don't match booking names, and even 4.5-star reviews can cause short-term rental hosts to reject travelers outright.

item.title: This is the most affordable country for expats in 2024, according to a new report
item.description: Vietnam was ranked No. 1 in terms of personal finances for expats, according to InterNation's Expat Insider 2024 report.

item.title: Japan and Philippines' defense pact seeks to counter China's aggression in the region, experts say
item.description: Japan and the Philippines have signed a landmark defense pact, allowing exchanges of armed forces for training and military exercises amid China concerns.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Are markets too optimistic?
item.description: S&P 500, Nasdaq close at all-time highs; Elliott threatens proxy fight, Germany’s bitcoin sale pressures prices

item.title: 'No one is picking up the phone': Joe Biden's fundraising confronts new hurdles after debate
item.description: President Joe Biden's fundraising is showing some signs of struggle, despite his insistence that he'll stay in the race.

item.title: Japan stocks and India's Nifty 50 hit fresh highs as Asia-Pacific markets rise
item.description: Asia-Pacific markets rose on Tuesday, tracking gains on Wall Street that saw the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite closing at record highs overnight.

item.title: 'Make or break week:' Stifel sees 40% chance of President Biden dropping out of the race
item.description: Brian Gardner, Stifel's chief Washington policy strategist, said it is a "make or break week" for President Joe Biden's campaign.

item.title: San Francisco's AI boom can't stop real estate slide, as office vacancies reach new record
item.description: Office vacancies in San Francisco hit another record in the second quarter, and rent prices fell to their lowest since 2015, according to Cushman & Wakefield.

item.title: The German government owns around $2 billion in bitcoin — and it's freaking out crypto investors
item.description: For weeks, Germany's government has been selling hundreds of millions of dollars worth of bitcoin, placing pressure on the world's largest cryptocurrency.

item.title: Amazon's Asian rival Shein wants to be supply chain giant, but some fear Chinese cyber spying inside global trade links
item.description: Shein's plans to sell supply-chain tech and services around the world have U.S. cybersecurity experts warning of the potential for Chinese spying.

item.title: Parkinson's disease expert visited the White House this year, met with Biden's doctor: NBC News
item.description: President Biden faces growing pressure to drop out of the 2024 presidential race against Donald Trump after his poor debate showing.

item.title: Corning shares pop 12% as AI boom drives stronger-than-expected demand for equipment
item.description: The company credits the outperformance to demand for its optical connectivity products used in generative artificial intelligence.

item.title: Southeast Asia's IPO market fell drastically in the first half, but AI listings could revive it
item.description: IPO market capitalization in Southeast Asia dropped 71% year on year to $5.8 billion in the first six months of 2024, a Deloitte report showed.

item.title: Media, tech titans head for Sun Valley with streaming alliances top of mind
item.description: Media and tech titans will convene at Allen & Co.'s annual conference this week, where streaming and sports alliances will be top of mind.

item.title: Paramount agrees to merge with Skydance, ending monthslong negotiations and Redstone era
item.description: Paramount agrees to merge with Skydance, bringing new ownership to the storied movie studio and CBS broadcast network long controlled by the Redstone family.

item.title: Serena Williams tried to deposit her first $1 million check at a drive-thru ATM: 'If I didn't win, I wasn't thinking'
item.description: Serena Williams says her early-career money habits were shaped by her competitive focus — which was so strong that she nearly forgot to collect her paychecks.

item.title: Amazon announces new $79 Echo Spot alarm clock
item.description: It is the first upgrade to the device since Amazon first introduced the Echo Spot in 2017.

item.title: Hollywood theater owners are worried a Paramount-Skydance merger will usher in too much consolidation
item.description: Paramount and Skydance have long been production partners, co-financing and distributing about 30 films.

item.title: Air travel demand is breaking records. Airline profits are not
item.description: Investors will get more insight into the outlook for the tail end of summer when Delta Air Lines kicks off earnings season Thursday.

item.title: France avoided a far-right election win — now the radical far left is demanding power
item.description: After the left-wing's election success in France, all eyes are now on radical firebrand Jean-Luc Melenchon who has demanded the left be given the premiership.

item.title: French President Macron’s snap election gamble 'did not pay off,' professor says
item.description: The gamble that French President Macron took when he called a snap election in the country has not paid off, Armin Steinbach, professor at HEC Paris said.

item.title: Ukrainian children's hospital hit, 31 people killed in daytime Russian missile attack
item.description: Russian forces launched more than 40 missiles across Ukraine, seriously damaging a children's hospital in Kyiv, Ukrainian officials said.

item.title: What a hung parliament in France could mean for markets
item.description: Initial indications on Sunday evening for the French parliamentary run-off vote threw up some big surprises.

item.title: Europe markets close mixed, French stocks volatile after left-wing's surprise election win
item.description: French stocks were volatile on Monday as markets reacted to a surprise win for the left in the country's parliamentary election.
